intro: Chorizanthe chaetophora, commonly known as the hairy cholla, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of small, greenish flowers. The plant has adapted to arid environments with its succulent leaves and ability to store water in its stems. Its flowers are typically arranged in dense, cylindrical clusters and are pollinated by insects. Chorizanthe chaetophora is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
